title: Goodbye 2013
description: Awesome wrap of the year 2013 show. Yvette Harvie-Salter and Bryce Langston (www.brycelangston.com) talks about their musical duet experience. Daniel Habedank joins us once again and sings a couple of songs live.

title: Under the Afro
description: Evan Silva talks about his book 'Under The Afro' and shares some fascinating stories.

title: A naughty episode
description: Sex, drugs and rock'n'roll - reviews of 'Wild Tales' by Graham Nash, ex - Hollies front man and Crosby Stills Nash and Young band member with Art, Paula Crimmens reviews 'Mr Pip', David and Goliath' by Malcolm Gladwell and 'Stuff I've been reading' by Nick Hornby. With music from The Doors, The Moody Blues, Green Day, ZZ Top, Willie Mae Big Mama Thornton , Carlos Montoya and Frank Sinatra.

title: Some serious topics
description: The subject of suicide dominates KickArts this week with photographer Ida Larsson talking about Project 547 â€“ a photographic Exhibition about suicide in Aotearoa. Chantal Samuela and Jason Wu talk about Phoenix's play, 'The Elephant in the Garden of Gethsemane' also touching on issues for young people including suicide. - ELEPHANT IN THE GARDEN OF GETHSEMANE plus writer and historian Damien Fenton talks about his book, New Zealand at War 1914-1919. With music from Sonny Boy Williamson and Tom Waits.

title: Let's talk about theatre
description: From 'Sex Show' to 'Family Show', Outfit Theatre Company directors Sarah Graham and Ema Barton talk about 'Robin Hood', Dawson Clutterbuck talks 'Rangahaua' - his exhibition opening at the NZ Film Archive, Nic Sampson and Barnaby Fredric, writers of The Basement's 'Christmas Carol' talk theatre, writing and careers. And we talk NYTC's 'Aladdin'. With music by Tina Turner, Jimi Hendrix and The Black Eyed Peas.

title: Ghe Genie in the Lamp
description: KickArts awesomeness with special guest Seamus Ford, director of the NYTC production' 'Aladdin' opening this week. Paul Crimmens reviews 'Between the Sheets' and Enny Benzonelli reviews the GALS Concert. We talk about 'Mix and Match' as well as play the winners of the NZ Music Awards: Lorde, Fat Freddy's Drop, Lawrence Arabia, Aaradhna, Villany and Pete Posa. We also listen to Catherine George sewing costumes in the background.

title: Generations
description: Kicking arse on KickArts this week: Beth Allen (Shortland Street) talks about her upcoming play, 'Between the Sheets' with Jennifer Ward Lealand, Gloria Stanford reads some of her poetry and discusses the bioplay 'Gloria' opening at TAPAC, James Luck, dancer, talks 'Chicago' by the Auckland Theatre Company and Adam Fresco is all about the film. We also talk to Donald Bassett about his book, 'Fix, the life of Felix Kelly' with music from Jethro Tull, Neil Young and Diana Krall.

title: Enny, calm down!
description: An action - packed KickArts with more inappropriate behaviour from co-host Enny Benzonelli, film talk with Adam Fresco, Paula Crimmens looks at Jennifer Saunders' new book, 'Bonkers' and Merrin H Cavel reviews the Actor's Programme's Grad piece, 'Camino Real', and SPECIAL GUESTS director of 'Auckland Daze', Kiel McNaughton and GALS singer, Ash Barratt.

title: Healthy Debate
description: Debate and discourse - are there too many graduates being churned out of drama / dance courses to meet the need? Who is responsible to train them in survival? Are things different from 10 years ago? A robust discussion as well as news, views and interviews on Auckland's comprehensive arts show - KICKARTS.

title: Labour Weekend
description: A Labour Weekend Special: Emma and Enny talks TV, Musicals and play with KickArts's stings. Emma reviews Wicked and Enny plays Belorussian and Italian music. A show you don't want to miss!

title: Reviews, Interviews and more
description: Reviews of 'Same Same but Different', 'A Thousand Hills', 'Rudali the Mourner' and 'The Feast'. We talk 'Gravity' and interview Sophie Roberts about Silo Theatre's latest offering, 'Midsummer'... with Enny Benzonelli, Paula Crimmens, Emma Bishop and Adam Fresco.

title: Liber-Arts
description: Girl on Girl / Boy on Boy - sexy sultry circus - 'Same Same but Different' instigator/performer Edward Clendon and composer / performer Flavio Villani join us to talk about the show on this weekend as part of the Tempo Dance Festival NZ. We talk 'Gravity' and review 'The Thing From The Place' and 'Carnival Hound'. Tributes to author Tom Clancy and astronaut Scott Carpenter through music.

title: Some skin doesn't hurt
description: Naked Dancers, Flying Dutchmen and a Snot Monster? Another great show last Sunday with Carrie Rae Cunningham from Tempo Dance Festival NZ, Jamie Moana, winner of The National Institute of Creative Arts and Industries (NICAI) Songwriter of the Year Award and Justin Jade Morgan from Artweek Auckland. We review the 'Flying Dutchman' and 'Young and Hungry' plus discuss the end of 'Breaking Bad'.

title: KickArts feeds you
description: Young, Hungry - looking for a Feast? Look no further than Sunday's KickArts - Shadon Meredith, Director of a young and hungry offering joins us along with Ella Becroft, producer of 'The Feast'. We review Tim Bray Productions' 'Mrs Wishy Washy', Auckland Theatre Company's 'Lord of the Flies' and 'Birds' by Dianna Fuemana. Enny Benzonelli looks at winners at this year's Emmy Awards, and Adam Fresco reviews 'Planes', 'Turbo' and 'Riddick'.

title: Mayoral Debate
description: KICKARTS SPECIAL: Mayoral debate on the Arts in Auckland - Len Brown, John Minto and John Palino discuss and debate their views on the importance of the arts in our city. Important to listen as you prepare to vote in the local body elections.

title: From Auckland to Rwanda
description: From the bloody massacres in Rwanda to the stage at TAPAC - Francois Byamana talks about his play 'A Thousand Hills' along with writer, Mike Hudson. On a lighter note 'Mrs. Wishy-Washy' actor Hamish McGregor who plays the title role talks about his journey from Invercargill to Auckland to play the part, Adam Fresco gives us more insight into what's hot and what's not in the film scene, and Richard Green reviews 'Kiss The Fish', the latest offering from Indian Ink Theatre Company - on at Q Theatre.

title: Funny one
description: A laugh a minute with Australian Comedienne Andrea Gibbs joining us in the studio, as well as the talented Scotty Cottor (Dir) and actor Bianca Seinafo from the upcoming production of 'Birds' at the Basement. Susan Rose joins us to review 'Romeo and Tusi' plus the talented Adam Fresco provides his usual insight into film reviews and news.

title: Mixed flavours
description: Island Shakespeare, Ice Cream and more inappropriate comments from Enny - a great show with guests from 'Romeo and Tusi' and the Unitec 'ChoreoFest 2013'. We also review 'After Miss Julie' currently on at the Basement Theatre.

title: What can we say: Dodgy!
description: Very dodgy show with some very dodgy guests - I am sure there will be complaints to the BSA! But loads of fun nonetheless! Erroll Shand and Jodie Hillock join us to talk about 'After Miss Julie', opening at the Basement Theatre Tuesday 27th August. Enny Benzonelli and Adam Fresco argue over 'Resident Alien', Adam also shares some great movies reviews and gossip, Emma Bishop adds her 2 cents while Richard Green barely manages to control the studio. An hilarious KickArts!

title: Porn, Paris and Politics
description: Porn, Paris and Politics all on KickArts - a great show Sunday Night. Reviews of 'Motel' (Basement) and 'Speaking in Tongues' (Herald), 'Elysium' (Film), 'Wolverine' (Film), Preview of 'Te Awarua' (Pumphouse) and exhibition 'A Different View: Artists address pornography' (Gus Fisher Gallery). Plus a discussion on arts in the curriculum... not to be missed.

title: Resident Alien
description: Reviews of 'The Brave', 'Defensibility' and 'Sydney Bridge Upside Down' - plus Roy Ward joins us to talk about 'Resident Alien' and Adam Fresco brings his film reviews and news... plus music from the BDO 14 with Enny Benzonelli, Mary Wadsworth and Paula Crimmens.

title: Star struck
description: A celebrity riddled show with Claire Van Beek (Sydney Bridge Upside Down at Q Theatre), Cameron Rhodes (Motel at Basement Theatre) and Don Bassett talking about the Auckland Art Gallery's latest exhibition, 'Californian Design' and of course Adam Fresco talks film.

title: How to make a movie with few dollars
description: Sophie Henderson, 'Fantail' (NZIFF) writer and actor from chats about the trials of low budget features. Jenni Heka, Producer at Massive Theatre Company discusses her career and the upcoming tour of 'The Brave'. Adam Fresco reviews 'One Man Star Wars' at the Bruce Mason and discusses his NZIFF movies plus Enny reviews 'Devious Maids'.

title: Movie Galore
description: So many films! We look at 'Behind the Candelabra', 'The Rocket' and 'Starlet' as part of the NZIFF, a great interview with filmmaker Antony Powell - the eye behind 'Antarctica, a Year on Ice'. Adam Fresco reviews 'No Holds Bard' and I look at 'Pippi Longstockings' and Paula Crimmens reviews 'Tu' on at Q Theatre.

title: New Zealand International Film Festival
description: Film maker Amy Taylor talks about her doco, 'Soul in the Sea' premiering in the NZIFF this month, Maatu Ngaporo joins us to talk about the play 'Tu' opening at Q Theatre, Adam Fresco discusses his picks in the NZIFF and reviews 'Pacific Rim' and I talk with Don Bassett who reviews Stephen Sinclair's 'Intimacies' and also takes time to look at two exhibitions currently on in Auckland.

title: Selfpublishing music
description: Enny welcomes Benji Dalton and they talk movies, TV and more. They go into depth how to self publish music on SoundCloud. An episode not to be missed.

title: A classic KickArts
description: From 'Braindead' to 'Russian Snark' with Stephen Sinclair, writer and director, discussing his upcoming show, 'Intimacies', carver Tim Codyre talks about his new exhibition at Allpress Gallery, Don Bassett looks at the 5th Auckland Triennial currently running till August and reviews ATC's 'Anne Boleyn', Enny Benzonelli reviews 'Grace', on at Centrestage and Richard Green reviews Company of Giant's production of 'The Odyssey' plus some awesome free jazz on KickArts.

title: Pippi Calzelunghe
description: Luke Wilson joins us on KickArts to talk 'Pippy Longstockings' and life as an actor, Enny discusses 'Mr Selfridge', a new show starting on one, and we listen to some great kiwi music with concerts announced for 'Fly My Pretties' and 'Fat Freddy's Drop' announce their much anticipated 'Blackbird' album release.

title: The Odyssey of Gloria
description: What a great show - Laurel Devinie - Company of Giant's director of 'The Odyssey' opening at TAPAC next week joins us, along with Gloria and Amy from 'Gloria', the return of the great 2011 fringe show re-loved and re-worked and Catherine Mayo, New Zealand author and writer of the newly released 'Murder at Mykenai'. We review 'K'Rd Strip' and 'With a Stranger' and also look back at the 3rd series of 'Game of Thrones'.

title: Drag, Drama and Dance
description: Drag Queens and Drama Queens, dancers and actors, 'K'Rd Strip', the new offering from Okareka Dance Company opens a NZ tour in Auckland this week. Artistic Director Taane Mete and performer Adam Burrell join Richard Green in the studio for another great KickArts!

title: Theatre and more Theatre
description: A 'Classics' show on KickArts... 'Oedipus' and 'Titus' reviewed with 'Hamlet' and Comedy of Errors' previewed... some great theatre on in Auckland at the moment ... plus news, reviews and interviews with Enny Benzonelli, Paula Crimmens, Emma Bishop and Richard Green.

title: Pacific Special
description: The Pacific Music Awards are tonight and Rev Mua Strickson-Pua joined our show in his role as Chair of the committee - we talk Pacific music, politics and play a few of his favs. Plus he shares a poem about SkyCity. We are also joined by Lizzie and Caleb, opening tonight in 'Oedipus the King' at Centennial Theatre.

title: Emma's Back
description: An exciting episode of KickArts. Enny will be joined by David Sutherland and Paul Lewis from the show Titus (coming soon at the Q Theatre). Emma Bishop (yes, she is back) and Paula Crimmens will review some shows. For the NZ Music Month Enny will choose some Kiwi music (that sounds intriguing...) and if there is some time left we will review some Sci-Fi movies currently screening in our theaters.

title: Eli & Mario
description: Eli Matthewson â€“ Billy T nominee joins us on the show along with Mario Demiraj - musician and writer - with a new EP coming up. Also we celebrate MZ MUSIC MONTH with some more KickArts NZ songs.

title: NZ Music Month
description: NZ Music Month - some great kiwi tunes old and new with Lorde, Newmatics (with Kelly Rogers), Little Lapin and Villainy, Enny Benzonelli and Richard Green talk 'Game of Thrones and we reviews 'Idiots of Ants' at the Comedy Festival. Speaking of Comedy - John and James from 'Jim John Jam' talk about their show on this week and Don Bassett reviews a film from the Architecture and Design Film Festival on at the Rialto.

title: The Hottest Festival in Town
description: What's hot and what's hotter at the Reader's and Writer's Festival with Mary Wadsworth, 'Madam Butterfly' - does it fly? with Don Bassett, special guests are Graduation Gala Concerto Finalists Linda, Liam and Shauno, 'Battle of the Bastards' writer / director David Ladderman and Richard Green reviews 'Andrew Clay's Book of Love' at Q Theatre - Comedy Festival show with Enny Benzonelli.

title: Docu Reviews
description: Andrew Clay - comedian and playwright - talks about 'Book of Love' in the Comedy Festival, Mary Wadsworth discusses the NZ Post Children's Book Awards and Don Bassett reviews the Sonatas by NZ Pianist Michael Houston. Meanwhile Enny and Richard review 8 docos seen in the Documentary Edge Festival.

title: Jamie and her Music
description: Sunday's show with singer / songwriter Jamie McDell talking about her music, her life and her causes with a few live songs in the studio. Sam Berkley from 'The Dragon of an ordinary family' talks about the show, his career and life as an actor - a little bit of Black Sabbath and a little bit of Enny ang his take on 'The Island President' showing at the Documentary Edge Festival at Q Theatre.

title: Art, Music and Movies
description: KickArts this week with Adam Fresco reviewing 'Identity Thief' & 'Perks of Being A Wallflower', Musician and singer Lionel Reekie talks about his recent trip to Russia to sing with the prestigious Novosibirsk Philharmonia, Anthony Towler talks bout his play 'Defensibility' that has been postponed after the fire at the Musgrove, and Don Bassett looks at the Angels and Aristocrats exhibition at the Auckland Art Gallery... with co-host Emma Bishop.

title: News, views and Reviews
description: Barnie Duncan features on KickArts this week talking about 'Constantinople' at the Basement Theatre (finishes Saturday - get along and see it!), Dan and Alex from the Documentary Edge Festival join us and discuss documentary in New Zealand and what we can expect to see at the Festival, Don Bassett reviews 'King Lear' and 'War Requiem' and I review 'Le Tonu' - seen at the Basement Theatre last week. Plus other news, views and reviews with Enny Benzonelli.

title: TV, Concerts and Reviews
description: Awesome fun show this week with Enny Benzonelli, Mary Wadsworth, Don Bassett and Adam Fresco - 'Jack the Giant Slayer' any good? Dawn McMillian's books enjoyable? Is 'Kingdom of Plants' a TV show worth watching? Was Joan Armatrading's concert at the Bruce Mason Centre worth going to? Lots of laughs, news, reviews and interviews.

title: Addicted to Art
description: Catherine George, ASB Grants Advisor and self-confessed Arts Addict joins us live in the studio to talk about her experience of the Fringe Festival and what's coming up at the Auckland Arts Festival. Enny reviews Samsara and we play songs about the rain.

title: We love Live Music
description: In this episode Mary Wadworth reviews a couple of sporty, motivational books. Paula Crimmens shares her experience at 'Breath of the Volcano'. Richard and Adam talk movies and our special guest Daniel Habedank sings live.

title: NZ Book Month is here
description: An amazing show, Paula looks at Promise and Promiscuity, Mary introduces New Zealand Book Month reviews two great books, well you have to listen to the show discover them. A sprinkle of Richard and Adam mixed with Enny reviewing Spring Awakening. Lot of music... A KickArts you don't want to miss.

title: And the Oscar goes to...
description: A KickArts OSCARS SPECIAL with Adam Fresco, Enny Benzonelli and Mary Wadsworth from the Point Chevalier Bookshop joins us once more for another great book review.

title: The Faulty Sky Tower
description: A great show (despite the technical difficulties - thanks Sky Tower!) if not a little shorter... Enny Benzonelli looks at the BAFTAS, Adam Fresco joins us again with some great film reviews, Alissa Angelini joins us from Auckland Alliance Francaise French Film Festival which opens next week AND 71Sunset play LIVE in the studio.

title: What does it take to be a critic?
description: Theatre reviewer James Wenley joins Richard Green, Enny Benzonelli, Mary Wadsworth and Emma Bishop to discuss his role - and we are joined by some of the cast of 'Spring Awakening' - we look at 'The ACB with Honora Lee' by Kate de Goldi and 'The Blue Rose'. Thrown into the mix is some Bob Marley - celebrating his birthday last Wednesday.

title: Is Shakespeare still relevant?
description: Should Shakespeare be taught at High School and University? Listen to the discussion on last week's KickArts - we are joined by Prema, Jason and Daniel from 'Merchant of Venice' currently at the Pumphouse Theatre - Also Enny, Adam and Mary join us for news, reviews and interviews on Auckland's comprehensive arts show.

title: Sandy, oh Sandy...
description: Sandy Silver, life member of the Actor's Studio in NY, director, actor and masterclass teacher joins us live in the studio this Sunday for an exclusive interview about her amazing career. Adam Fresco reviews 'Django Unchained' and Enny Benzonelli joins Richard Green for another kick arse KickArts - Auckland's comprehensive arts show.

title: The Rise of Richard Green
description: Richard is back, stronger than ever! Hayley and Josh join us and talk about their projects. Enny reviews 666 Park Avenue and has a look to the 77th Golden Globe Awards.

title: The Hijackers
description: This week Actor Phil Vaughn ex- Big Wednesday presenter discusses his new life as an actor, plus Enny Benzonelli and Emma Bishop hijack the show to bring you another great KickArts.

title: The Story of Lara
description: Fortune Theatre Artistic Director Lara Macgregor talks about her career, being in New York on 9/11 and her new life in Dunedin on last week's KickArts.

title: A look into 2013
description: Richard and Mary talk about books to read over the summer. Enny presents the 2013 new TV shows coming to New Zealand. We review and present lots of festivals coming up in Auckland.

title: Celluloid Special
description: A 2013 Movie Special on KickArts! Adam Fresco joins Enny Benzonelli, Emma Bishop and Richard Green to look at the best and possibly the worst offerings at the movies over the next 12 months including Cloud Atlas, Django Unchained, Hansel & Gretel: Witch Hunters, Pain & Gain, Kick-Ass 2, The Lone Ranger, The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug and many more! PLUS christmas carols galore!

title: I can smell Christmas
description: Adam Fresco reviews 'Life of Pi' and 'Sightseers', Colin James Woods joins us in the studio to talk about his new album, 'Skywalk to Carpark'. Emma Bishop and Richard Green discuss 'Pointy Dog Dance Company' and review their show 'Here we are and here we go', 'The Santa Claus Show' by Tim Bray Productions gets a review, while Enny Benzonelli joins us to discuss everything TV... and 'The Hobbit'. Moreover, Richard interviews Roger Taberner from the Auckland Art Gallery about 'Who Shot Rock and Roll'.

title: The First Award
description: On the award winning KickArts, we are joined by Emma Bishop to discuss the Fringe Festival programme, Enny Benzonelli is back with 'Dexter', Adam Fresco looks at the Danish movie starring Pierce Brosnan, 'Love is All You Need' and two French movies, 'Welcome Aboard' and 'You are My Son' on 'Flicks and Features', and our special in studio guests are from the dance company, 'Pointy Dog Dancers' who's show opens at TAPAC.

title: Fashion, Docus and Theatre
description: This episode features Adam Fresco chatting with Richard Green about the fashion documentary 'Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel'; the Sundance and Cannes Festivals hit 'Beasts of the Southern Wild', and Brett Morgen's Rolling Stones doco, 'Crossfire Hurricane'.. Paul Frewin reviews Auckland band Yebiisu's EP Exit City, Paula Crimmens reviews 'Where Are You My Only One' currently on at the Basement Theatre, Enny Benzonelli reviews 'Alcatraz' and we hear a little Rolling Stones and a little Danny Kaye.

title: My Name is Arts... KickArts
description: Adam Fresco reviews the new James Bond movie, Enny Benzonelli looks at the new TV1 drama, 'Pan Am', our special studio guest is Sophie Vowell from the Basement Theatre and I review Atamira Dance Company's 'Tohu' featuring Taane Mete that was on at Corbans Estate Art Centre this week. As well we catch up with Don Bassett who looks at Warwick Henderson's book, 'Behind the Canvas'.

title: Show not Available
description: We are sorry, we have no information available for this show. If you have it, get in touch with us, we'd love to add it to our archives.

title: Legal Downloads
description: The Atamira Dance Company joins us in the studio, Curator of Contemporary Arts, Natasha Conland, discusses the new acquisition at the Auckland Art Gallery, Adam Fresco introduces a few foreign films hitting our shores, Paul Frewin reviews the Radiohead concert, Sean Lyons from NetSafe clarifies the legalities over downloading TV from the Internet, Jo Holsted and Michelle Ang come and talk about their play 'Chop/Stick' which opens at the Basement Theatre this week, and Richard Green reviews '13'.

title: Live Music with Arli
description: Listen to the awesome live sound of Arli Liberman! Also with Paul Frewin, Adam Fresco, Enny Benzonelli, Mary Wadsworth and Grae Burton with news, reviews and interviews...

title: Chim- Chimney
description: What a show - We have Enny reviewing 'Smash', Emma talks about 'Mary Poppins', Paula reviews 'Paper Sky' by Red Leap, Richard went to see 'Bootleg Beatles' and talks about the great show he saw and in the studio Sefa Enari and Tupua Tigafua from Pacific Dance join us, talking about the dance lab coming up. From the Actor's studio, Jordan Selwyn and Lauren Gibson from '13' also join us.

title: Adam: The Reviewer
description: Adam reviews 'Taken 2', 'Dredd' and 'The Sessions', Don Bassett looks at the Fiona Pardington exhibition at 2 Rooms, we talk to Deborah White about ARTWEEK and Richard reviews 'Nga Hau e Wha' from the Okareka Dance Company. As well we have Enny reviewing 'Revolution' and Art's Archives brings us another rare and interesting album.

title: Reviews Galore
description: Enny looks at the new season of 'Downton Abbey', Emma reviews 'Lily' as part of the Tempo Dance Festival and the living encyclopedia Don Basset talks with Richard about the book and the movie 'On The Road'. What a classy episode.

title: The 90 minutes show
description: KickArts moves to 90 MINUTES! Yes, our new extended format show has the following: Adam Fresco reviews 'Looper', Enny Benzonelli reviews 'Glee', Emma Bishop reviews 'Red Chair', Mary Wadsworth reviews Sebastian Faulks' book, 'A Possible Life', Don Bassett looks at Bosshart's jewellery exhibition at Objectspace, as well as 'The Bartered Bride' and 'The Gift' by ATC, Richard Green talks to Lisa Scott about her new book, 'Travels with my Economist', Paul Frewin plays us some music from Roofdog's self titled album and Molly (aged 4) reviews Tim Bray's 'Hairy McClary' which has been on at the Pumphouse... phew - a busy show!

title: South Side Arts Festival
description: This episode of KickArts featuring Tim Bray, Naomi Singer from the South Side Arts Festival, Ann Dewey talking about her dance tour in Rodney and the usual suspects Enny, Emma and Richard with news, views and reviews.

title: The usual suspects... review
description: 'Two Little Boys' - reviewed by Adam Fresco, 'Stir Fried Plays' - reviewed by Emma Bishop, Miho Wada's latest offering reviewed by Paul Frewin and 'Continuum' previewed by Enny Benzonelli. Richard Green also looks at the Wiggles Farewell Concert, and the inspiration behind The Beatles' 'Revolution'.

title: InterActing Urban Chicks
description: In this episode of KickArts - 'Urban Chicks', a new book by Renee Lang and photographer, Trevor Newman... Paula Crimmens on her disability arts theatre company, InterActing, Art's Archives examines electropop in the form of British band, GoldFrapp and what was the inspiration behind George Harrison's 'While my guitar gently weeps?'

title: A bit of Opera
description: A great Kickarts show with Emma Bishop reviewing Len Lye the Opera, Enny Benzonelli looking at the second series of The Killing, Mary Wadsworth from the Resource Room reviewing Daughters of Mars by Thomas Keneally and Arts Archives is back again, this week looking at Linda Ronstadt's album, Simple Dreams.

title: Books & Movies
description: Enny Benzonelli reviews 'Nothing Trivial', Adam Fresco looks at 'Expendables 2' and talks about film maker, Tony Scott, 'Redemption Song' makes an appearance in various forms and our special in-studio guest is writer, James Crompton who talks about his new book 'In the dead of Winter'.

title: Talkin' Arts
description: Great show with Paula Crimmens, Enny Benzonelli, Arts Archives featuring Status Quo, Roger Horricks from Len Lye the Opera, Tracey and Jacinta from The Producers Project - great discussion about the arts in Auckland!

title: The Ukulele of Dave
description: This week's show with Emma Bishop reviewing Grae Burton's 'Freeload', Enny Benzonelli talks about SoHo's new show, 'Newsroom'. Adam Fresco looks back over his picks at the New Zealand International Film Festival and Richard Green reviews 'The Pantry Shelf' with Matt Halliday. Helen from The Resource Room reviews Ian McEwen's book, 'Sweet Tooth'. And our special studio guest Dave Parker from the Nukes talks about the popularity of the Ukulele and the Encore Series currently running in Titirangi.

title: From Newmarket to Christchurch
description: Great show featuring George Henare, Jodie Hillock and Adey Ramsell from the Newmarket Stage Company; Enny Benzonelli discusses an upcoming banned episode of Fear Factor, Grae Burton tells us about his 2 new projects in Auckland and Christchurch planner Claire Gibb talks with us all about the plan in Christchurch and how that affects the arts in the city.

title: Vincent Ward's Special
description: A special show with Vincent Ward... From big screen to big canvases, renowned film director Vincent Ward is moving from Hollywood to the Shanghai Bienniale with his exhibition Inhale/Exhale - remarkable paintings in a watery world, along with a handful of large photographic pieces.

title: Emmet Skilton's first time
description: This week's show features The Almighty Johnson's actor, Emmett Couling Skilton. Enny Benzonelli looks at Grimm and NZ got's talent... Mary at the Resource Room discusses Margaret Mahy's life and Art's Archives shares Getz/Gilberto.

title: Bill Gosden, reviews and TV
description: Bill Gosden interview, review of Red Leap's 'The Arrival', A book review by Helen at the Resource Room, Enny looks at the reality TV market in NZ and Adam reviews 'The Dark Night Rises' and 'Abraham Lincoln, Vampire Hunter'... all go at KickArts.

title: Reviews, Interviews and Dance
description: Our studio guest this week is choreographer and dancer Taane Mete, Emma Bishop reviews 'Carousel', Enny Benzonelli joins us again and eulogises 'Desperate Housewives' and looks at TV One's 'The Missing'. Richard Green catches up with actor Morgana Le Fay O'Reillyover a coffee and chat about her career and Art's Archives look at Gert/Gilberto.

title: The Pilot
description: In the pilot episode of KickArts, Richard Green talks to Haare Williams, Enny Benzonelli and Paul Frewing.
